content:
We've got a lot of Drupal sites I will be migrating over to BD in the next six months or so...

@Steve Moorhouse - If this is the case, I hope we start seeing more of you in the Github core issue queue. Your eyes are fresher than many of ours, in terms of Backdrop, and we'd love to see you open bug reports and request features. Also comment on existing issues.

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.

We would love to hear your thoughts on issues such as:
https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/1169

[SR] Include Honeypot module in Backdrop by default for public forms. · Issue #1169 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
The comment module is included in core. That's fine BUT... Normal users aren't savvy enough to know that by enabling forms, they're exposing their sites to spammers and the likes. And, ...

Or: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3023

[META] Contact module improvements · Issue #3023 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Gathering issues about the contact module #1571 | [UX] Have contact.module enabled by default on the standard profile. #1572 | [UX] Have a "Contact" menu item be enabled and added to the ...

StPaulTim said:

We've got a lot of Drupal sites I will be migrating over to BD in the next six months or so...

Steve Moorhouse - If this is the case, I hope we start seeing more of you in the Github core issue queue. Your eyes are fresher than many of ours, in terms of Backdrop, and we'd love to see you open bug reports and request features. Also comment on existing issues.

Yeah, no problem... I just need to learn more about github :smile:

I just need to learn more about github

Well, don't hesitate to ask questions. It's in our interest to help you get more involved, we'll happily help you figure it out.

@Steve Moorhouse - Here is a good example. I had a hard time trying to figure out something that should have been easy. I think we could add an easy clue for 'future me' right there in the UI, so I open an issue on Github. I'll even submit a PR, once someone tells me that this is not a bad idea.

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4555

Better help text for layout path field · Issue #4555 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need I just spend a long time trying to figure out the correct path to create a custom layout for taxonomy terms. https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/how-do-i-configure-custom-la...

It might be a bad idea and folks might tell me why. But, that's fine. At least we addressed the issue, potentially came up with alternate ideas, and documented it in the issue queue for the future (documented the problem, the rejected solution, why it was rejected, and possible alternatives.)
@klonos - is there an issue for this already? ;-)
@StPaulTim of course there is ...there are a few related ones actually:

#1602

[UX] Using * or % as a wildcard in layout paths does not have expected behavior · Issue #1602 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
bug report from email: I have result pages where I need the full page width for content. Created custom layout, one column, picked the url string (results/*) as a page identifier, saved. Cleared al...

#2411

[UX] Layout paths -- clarify system path vs. alias · Issue #2411 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
I was trying to set up a layout to apply to a 'subsection' of the site and am running into some difficulty. I'll explain here one of the issues and if needed open separate issues for ot...

#2618

[UX] Layout path selection: Make it more user friendly · Issue #2618 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
From a Gitter conversation but similar sentiments at #2411 and #2306 Sam Stamport @ColumbiaBlooms 07:51 Please explain the relationship between Path and Visibility Conditions on the layout configur...

I suspect that nothing quite as specific as mine, but I'd be surprised if there weren't bigger issues that relate to this. I did a little searching and didn't find anything, but the github search is not as accurate as the @klonos search.
...what would be scary/weird would be that I'd remember those by heart :sweat_smile:
The most relevant of those 3 would be the last one.
...but adding a help text would be a great interim solution.

@StPaulTim I know you have a lot on your plate, but I think that you should advocate for #2618 for 1.18.0

[UX] Layout path selection: Make it more user friendly · Issue #2618 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
From a Gitter conversation but similar sentiments at #2411 and #2306 Sam Stamport @ColumbiaBlooms 07:51 Please explain the relationship between Path and Visibility Conditions on the layout configur...

Comment in issue queue:

..would be nice to add an example for comments too.

@klonos - does that mean you might support a simple help text change until some of these bigger issues are addressed?
Yes :+1:
OK, I may do a quick PR soon (since it's so simple) and we can see if we get more feedback.
...those other issues are from 2017 and earlier. If they were easy to do, we'd already have done it. Adding some help text is easy, and can be done in a bug fix release.
Yes, 2618 does look like a great idea of the sort I'd be inclined to advocate for. I'll keep that in mind as a leading contender for 1.18.
I am hesitant to advocate for any changes to this page, until I better understand the current "contexts" issue, because I don't fully understand it's implications.
But, hopefully we'll get that sorted here in 1.17 and I'll have a clearer picture.
